intro: Caralluma rauhii, commonly known as the desert nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades such as tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom at night. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water. Caralluma rauhii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
